image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Michigan; born in Laurium, Houghton County, Mich., September 29, 1926; graduated from high school in 1944; Navy V-12 program, Central Michigan University and University of Michigan, 1944-1946; graduated from Yale University in 1948; served in United States Navy during Korean conflict as lieutenant (jg); director, Houghton National Bank, Commercial National Bank of L'Anse and R.L. Polk and Co.; elected as a Republican to the Ninetieth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1967-January 3, 1979); was not a candidate for reelection in 1978 to the Ninety-sixth Congress; unsuccessful candidate for the United States Senate in 1982; president of Woodlak Company to 1986; unsuccessful candidate for election in 1992 to the One Hundred Third Congress; is a resident of Houghton, Mich.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Ralph Nader Congress Project. Citizens Look at Congress: Philip E. Ruppe, Republican Representative from Michigan. Washington, D. C.: Grossman Publishers, 1972.

researchRecord.name: 1982, 17 commercials on 3 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Philip Ruppe's 1982 U. S. Senate campaign in Michigan, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: ca. 1966-1978, 160 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Philip Edward Ruppe contain congressional papers and correspondence, including motion picture film and memorabilia. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.

recordLocation.name: Archives and Copper Country Historical Collection
